result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status report 10-24-22

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Keenen Michael Hill.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant plans to hire a private attorney. Case is adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-6-22, filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Keenen Michael Hill.  Attorney Samuel Simpson for Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for Attorney Michael Staskunas for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for Scheduling conference.  Court advised there is a companion case, Case No. 22CF1733 currently before the Honorable Laura Crivello, Br. 36.
Case adjourned to Br. 36 for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-05-2022 filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court by video with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs who appears in person.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 22CF1092. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MCSO Deputy R. Wells. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court, appear by video with attorney Meera Al-Henaey appear by video for Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-6-2022

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court in person, defendant Keenen Michael Hill not in court, in custody.  ADA Hira appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant was taken into custody this morning and is currently in the booking process; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

05/06/2022. th
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keenen Michael Hill appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
